greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = mu(n)*(2n).
comment: a(n)/2 is multiplicative because both mu(n) and n are. - _Mitch Harris_, Jun 09 2005
b(n) = a(n)/a(1) is multiplicative with b(p^1) = -p, b(p^e) = 0 if e > 1. - _David W. Wilson_, Jun 12 2005
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
program: (PARI) { for (n=1, 1000, write("b062004.txt", n, " ", 2*n*moebius(n)) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 29 2009
results.author: _Jason Earls_, Jul 04 2001
